DATE.DATEADD: Returns the date corresponding to the date a specified number of units ('year', 'month', 'day', 'hour', 'minute' or 'second') before or after the original one.
DATE.DAY: Returns a number corresponding to the day in the month of the specified date.
DATE.DAYS: Returns the number of days between two dates.
DATE.EARLIER: Returns true is the first date is earlier than the second one, else returns false.
DATE.EQUAL: Returns true if the dates are equal, else returns false.
DATE.EOMONTH: Returns the date of the last day of the month a specified number of months before or after the original date.
DATE.HOUR: Returns a number corresponding to the hour of the specified date.
DATE.LATER: Returns true is the first date is later than the second one, else returns false.
DATE.MINUTE: Returns a number corresponding to the minutes of the specified date.
DATE.MONTH: Returns a number corresponding to the month of the specified date.
DATE.MONTHS: Returns the number of months between two dates.
DATE.SECOND: Returns a number corresponding to the seconds of the specified date.
DATE.WEEKDAY: Returns a number corresponding to the day in the week of the specified date.
DATE.WEEKNUM: Returns a number corresponding to the week number in the year of the specified date.
DATE.YEAR: Returns a number corresponding to the year of the specified date.
DATE.YEARS: Returns the number of years between two dates.

LOGIC.AND: Returns true if all conditions are true, else returns false.
LOGIC.IF: Returns the first result if the condition is true, else the second one.
LOGIC.IFS: Returns the result associated to the first true condition.
LOGIC.NOT: Returns false if the condition is true, else returns true.
LOGIC.OR: Returns true if at least one parameter is true, else returns false.
LOGIC.SWITCH: Returns the result associated to the first case which is equal to the comparative value, or returns the default result.

NUMERIC.ABS: Returns the absolute value of the specified number.
NUMERIC.AVERAGE: Returns the average of the specified numbers.
NUMERIC.CEILING: Rounds up a number to the nearest integer if it is a float number, else returns the specified number if it is an integer.
NUMERIC.DIVIDE: Returns the result of the division of the specified numbers.
NUMERIC.EQUAL: Returns true if the specified numbers are equal, else returns false.
NUMERIC.FLOOR: Rounds down a number to the nearest integer if it is a float number, else returns the specified number if it is an integer.
NUMERIC.GREATER: Returns true if the first number is greater than the second one, else returns false.
NUMERIC.GREATEREQ: Returns true if the first number is greater than the second one or if the two numbers are equal, else returns false.
NUMERIC.INT: Rounds the specified number to the nearest integer.
NUMERIC.LESS: Returns true if the first number is lower than the second one, else returns false.
NUMERIC.LESSEQ: Returns true if the first number is lower than the second one or if the two numbers are equal, else returns false.
NUMERIC.LOG: Returns the result of the logarithm function applied to the number with the specified base.
NUMERIC.MAX: Returns the largest number among the specified ones.
NUMERIC.MIN: Returns the smallest number among the specified ones.
NUMERIC.MOD: Returns the remainder from the division of two numbers.
NUMERIC.PRODUCT: Returns the result of the product of numbers
NUMERIC.ROUND: Rounds a number to a specified number of digits.
NUMERIC.SIGN: Returns -1 if the specified number is negative, 0 if it is a zero number and 1 if it is positive.
NUMERIC.SQRT: Returns the square root of the specified number.
NUMERIC.SUBTRACT: Returns the result of the subtraction of the specified numbers.
NUMERIC.SUM: Returns the result of the sum of the specified numbers.
NUMERIC.UNEQUAL: Returns true if the specified numbers aren't equal, else returns false.

TEXT.CONCAT: Returns the concatenation of the specified texts.
TEXT.EXACT: Returns true if the specified texts are equal, else returns false.
TEXT.FIND: Returns the position of the first occurrence of the searched text inside the other text, or 0 if the searched text is not included in the other one.
TEXT.LEFT: Returns the first characters of the text.
TEXT.LEN: Returns the length of the text.
TEXT.LOWER: Returns a lowercase copy of the text
TEXT.MID: Returns a specific number of characters from a given position of the specified text.
TEXT.REPLACE: Returns a copy of the original text in which a specific number of characters are replaced by a pattern from a given position.
TEXT.REPT: Returns a text containing a specific number of times the original text.
TEXT.RIGHT: Returns the last characters of the text.
TEXT.SUBSTITUTE: Returns a copy of the original text in which a pattern is replaced by a newer one.
TEXT.TEXTJOIN: Returns the concatenation of the specified texts, separated by a given separator.
TEXT.TRIM: Returns a copy of the original text without any spaces at the starting and the ending.
TEXT.UPPER: Returns an uppercase copy of the text.
